verses.verse: And the LORD said to Satan, (Mark 9:25; (Jude 9)) “The LORD rebuke you, Satan! The LORD who ((Rom. 8:33)) has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! (Amos 4:11; Jude 23) Is this not a brand plucked from the fire?”
Now Joshua was clothed with (Ezra 9:15; Is. 64:6) filthy garments, and was standing before the Angel.

Then He answered and spoke to those who stood before Him, saying, “Take away the filthy garments from him.” And to him He said, “See, I have removed your iniquity from you, (Gen. 3:21; Is. 61:10) and I will clothe you with rich robes.”
And I said, “Let them put a clean (Ex. 29:6) turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head, and they put the clothes on him. And the Angel of the LORD stood by.
The Coming Branch Then the Angel of the LORD admonished Joshua, saying,

“Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘If you will walk in My ways, And if you will (Lev. 8:35; Ezek. 44:16) keep My command, Then you shall also (Deut. 17:9, 12) judge My house, And likewise have charge of My courts; I will give you places to walk Among these who (Zech. 3:4) stand here.

‘Hear, O Joshua, the high priest, You and your companions who sit before you, For they are (Ps. 71:7) a wondrous sign; For behold, I am bringing forth (Is. 42:1) My Servant the (Is. 11:1; 53:2; Jer. 23:5; 33:15; Zech. 6:12) BRANCH.

For behold, the stone That I have laid before Joshua: ((Zech. 4:10; Rev. 5:6)) Upon the stone are (Ps. 118:22) seven eyes. Behold, I will engrave its inscription,’ Says the LORD of hosts, ‘And (Jer. 31:34; 50:20; Zech. 3:4) I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
(Zech. 2:11) In that day,’ says the LORD of hosts, ‘Everyone will invite his neighbor (1 Kin. 4:25; Is. 36:16; Mic. 4:4) Under his vine and under his fig tree.’ ”
Vision of the Lampstand and Olive Trees Now (Zech. 1:9; 2:3) the angel who talked with me came back and wakened me, (Dan. 8:18) as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.

And he said to me, “What do you see?” So I said, “I am looking, and there is (Rev. 1:12) a lampstand of solid gold with a bowl on top of it, (Ex. 25:37; (Rev. 4:5)) and on the stand seven lamps with seven pipes to the seven lamps.
(Rev. 11:3, 4) Two olive trees are by it, one at the right of the bowl and the other at its left.”
So I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, “What are these, my lord?”
Then the angel who talked with me answered and said to me, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
